results.title: Basic Sewing Skills for Stretch Knits
results.brief_description: Hosted by Paula Duncan, this Woman’s Day program will provide you with all of the necessary basic information on stretch knit sewing. Armed with the basics you will then be able to make garments ranging from loose fitting T-shirts to after-five frocks.

results.title: Elton John live in Australia. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: This concert, on December 14th 1986, before 11,000 people in the Sydney Entertainment Centre, was the last in the “Tour de Force”, a series of 27 performances covering all of Australia. This video is of the first half of the show which featured Elton and his 13 piece band. The whole show was also being televised live, via satellite, to an estimated audience of over 10 million people. Rated: G

results.title: Monterey pop
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, John Phillips and Lou Adler
results.brief_description: In June 1967, the Mamas and the Papas hosted a three day Pop Festival in Monterey, California. D.A. Pennebaker’s outstanding film is a record of extraordinary musicians and extraordinary insight into an era. This is the 60’s in celebration, exploding with new voices and optimistic energy. Performing artists include Janis Joplin, Otis Redding, Jimi Hendrix, Jefferson Airplane, Simon and Garfunkel, Scott McKenzie, Eric Burdon and the Animals, Canned Heat and The Who.

results.title: The Bruce Petty collection
results.creator_credit: Bruce Petty, Gil Brealey, Robin Hughes, Ron Saunders, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This is a unique collection of films that have been devised, written or directed by renowned cartoonist/filmmaker Bruce Petty for Film Australia. Multi-award winning LEISURE (14 mins, 1976) is an animated and lighthearted look at the worlds of work and leisure. It considers our changing patterns of work since life began and the effects the Industrial Revolution has had on our leisure time. (OSCAR for Best Animated Short Subject, 49th Academy Awards, Los Angeles, 1977). MEGALOMEDIA (28 mins, 1981) is a humorous, yet at the same time searching sweep through the development of media and its audiences. Max Gillies guides the audience through a rapid succession of thoughts and perceptions in three parts Media Machine, Media Market and Media Mind. Important issues are raised in an entertaining manner. In THE MOVERS (49 mins, 1987) the development of technology is examined; from the primitive age through to the nuclear age. It examines technology’s relationship with human beings and the human cost of the gap that is created between countries that are technologically advanced and those that are not.

results.title: Hats in the Ring
results.brief_description: Focuses on the role of women in local government and contains a collection of interviews with women involved in local government, including two Lord Mayors, Sallyanne Atkinson of Brisbane and Lecki Ord of Melbourne, Janice Crozio, former NSW Minister for Local Government, Dawn Fraser, NSW Member of Parliament, and Senator Margaret Reynolds, Minister of Local Government and Minister Assisting the Prime Minister on the Status of Women. Its aim is to encourage women to stand for.

results.title: Harder than Everest
results.brief_description: Of the ten Himalayan expeditions I’ve been on, climbing Mt Gasherbraum IV was the most challenging and spectacular - it was harder than Everest. These are the words of Tim Macartney-Snape, one of a group of seven climbers who actually made it to the summit and shot the entire experience on film at the same time. A spectacular and inspiring video about human achievement.

results.brief_description: Individual skills coaching has 26 alternative coaching segments designed to assist the player who is practicing by himself without the aid of other players. Presented by John Doyle.

results.title: Captain Socceroo 1-Team Skills Coaching
results.brief_description: John Doyle presents his famous soccer skills segments in two cassettes. “Teams skill coaching” looks at 26 different soccer skills that can be practised by teams or several players together. Presented by John Doyle.

results.title: Badminton for Beginners
results.brief_description: A guide to the basic strokes recommended by the Western Australian Badminton Association. This video is designed for both coaches of badminton, and for players new to the game. It clearly demonstrates and explains the fundamentals of stroke production, footwork and court movement.
